Submodules¶

fyodorpizza.usecases.get_menu module¶

class fyodorpizza.usecases.get_menu.GetMenu¶

Bases: object

Gets menu - a list of all Pizza.

Feature: Full list of pizzas (menu)
  As a user
  I want to see full list of all types of pizza
  So that I can choose the pizza I want

  Scenario: User opens the 'Pizzas' tab on the website
    When the user opens the 'Pizzas' tab on the website
    Then the the full list of pizza types is displayed

New in version 0.1.0.

fyodorpizza.usecases.get_statistics module¶

class fyodorpizza.usecases.get_statistics.GetStatistics¶

Bases: object

Gets statistics on Pizza ordered today.

Feature: Ordered pizzas statistics
  As a delivery service manager
  I want to see statistics about pizzas that were ordered on our website
  So that I am able to analyze it

  Scenario: Manager opens the 'Statistics' tab on our website
    When the manager opens the 'Statistics' tab on our website
    Then full list of pizzas ordered today is displayed
    And it is possible to filter the list by pizza status
    And it is possible to filter the list by pizza name

New in version 0.1.0.

get_stats_by_pizza(pizza)¶
get_stats_by_status(status)¶

fyodorpizza.usecases.post_order module¶

class fyodorpizza.usecases.post_order.PostOrder¶

Bases: object

Posts new Order.

Feature: Order pizza(s)
  As a user
  I want to order pizza

  Scenario: User chooses one or more pizzas and presses 'Order'
    Given that the user has entered his email address
    When the user chooses one or more pizzas and presses 'Order'
    Then an Order is created in the database
    And a confirmation is sent to the user's email address

New in version 0.1.0.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
pizza_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class fyodorpizza.test_s.PostOrderTest(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

client = <django.test.client.Client object>¶

Create 2 test Ingredient and Pizza.

test_can_post_order()¶

Make POST request and assert status code 201 and email is sent.

Make POST request with invalid params and assert status code 401.
